documents.text:
SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Service Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [DATE], between [CLIENT COMPANY], a corporation organized under the laws of Delaware ("Client"), and [SERVICE PROVIDER], a limited liability company organized under the laws of California ("Provider").

1. SERVICES
Provider agrees to perform the services described in Schedule A attached hereto and incorporated by reference ("Services"). Provider shall perform the Services in a professional and workmanlike manner consistent with industry standards.

2. COMPENSATION
In consideration for the Services, Client shall pay Provider the fees set forth in Schedule A. Payment terms are Net 60 days from invoice date. Late payments may be subject to a 1.5% monthly service charge.

3. TERM AND TERMINATION
This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue until terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days written notice. Either party may terminate immediately for material breach that remains uncured after ten (10) days written notice.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY
Provider acknowledges that it may have access to confidential information of Client. Provider agrees to maintain all confidential information in strict confidence for a period of five (5) years following termination of this Agreement.

5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All work product, deliverables, and materials created by Provider under this Agreement shall be owned exclusively by Client. Provider hereby assigns all rights, title, and interest in such work product to Client.

6. INDEMNIFICATION
Provider agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Client from and against any and all claims, damages, losses, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising from or relating to Provider's performance of the Services, including but not limited to claims of third parties.

7. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
In no event shall either party's liability exceed $10,000 in the aggregate. Neither party shall be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages.

8. FORCE MAJEURE
Neither party shall be liable for any delay or failure to perform due to causes beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, or government action.

9. GOVERNING LAW
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to conflict of law principles. Any disputes shall be resolved in the courts of Delaware.

10. ENTIRE AGREEMENT
This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior negotiations, representations, and agreements relating to the subject matter hereof.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first written above.

[SIGNATURE BLOCKS]

EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement ("Agreement") is made between TechCorp Industries, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Company"), and John Smith ("Employee").

1. POSITION AND DUTIES
Employee is hired as Senior Project Manager and shall perform duties typically associated with such position, including project oversight, team coordination, and client communication.

2. COMPENSATION
Employee shall receive an annual salary of $95,000, payable bi-weekly. Employee is eligible for annual performance bonuses at Company's discretion.

3. BENEFITS
Employee is entitled to health insurance, dental coverage, 401(k) participation with company matching, and 15 days paid vacation annually.

4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-COMPETE
Employee agrees not to disclose confidential information and shall not compete with Company for 12 months following termination within a 50-mile radius.

5. TERMINATION
Employment may be terminated by either party with two weeks' notice. Company may terminate immediately for cause.

This Agreement is governed by California law.

[SIGNATURE BLOCKS]

SOFTWARE LICENSE AGREEMENT

This Software License Agreement ("Agreement") is between SoftwareCorp LLC ("Licensor") and Enterprise Client Inc. ("Licensee").

1. GRANT OF LICENSE
Licensor grants Licensee a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the Software for internal business purposes only.

2. RESTRICTIONS
Licensee may not modify, reverse engineer, or distribute the Software. Maximum of 100 concurrent users.

3. FEES AND PAYMENT
License fee is $50,000 annually, payable in advance. Late payments incur 2% monthly penalty.

4. SUPPORT AND MAINTENANCE
Licensor provides 24/7 technical support and quarterly software updates during the license term.

5. WARRANTY DISCLAIMER
SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED 'AS IS' WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND.

6. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Licensor's total liability shall not exceed the annual license fee.

7. TERM
This Agreement is effective for one (1) year and automatically renews unless terminated with 90 days notice.

Governed by laws of New York.

[SIGNATURE BLOCKS]
